description: QGIS is used by various amateur and professional users to create, edit, visualize, and publish geospatial information. When a user saves a project by selecting Project → Save or Project → Save As... , QGIS creates a QGS file to store the information.
As the user saves a project with QGIS, the program creates a backup file in the same directory as the QGS project file. The backup file has the .qgs~ file extension.
